newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan ends slightly up at new eleven-week high.
newsitem.headline: Yuan ends slightly up at new eleven-week high.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed slightly up at 8.2934 against the U.S. dollar on Thursday from Wednesday's 8.2935, setting a new eleven-week high on pro-yuan sentiment, dealers said.
The weighted average price on Wednesday was 8.2938.
With no clear intervention seen from the central bank to depress the yuan, the yuan remained strong, although its rise slowed after continued gains over the past few days.
The yuan opened unchanged at 8.2935 and consolidated in a narrow range for most of the session, hitting an intraday low of 8.2937 and a high of 8.2930.

"The yuan has been moving at a high level for quite a while, but the expected central bank's intervention to depress the yuan has not appeared," said one dealer. "That strengthened pro-yuan sentiment."
Some dealers said they expected the yuan to test the 8.2930 level on Friday.
But one dealer said that after its strong gains, there was an increasing possibility of a correction in the absense of major positive news.
The yuan closed down at an intraday low of 6.6325 from 6.5955 against 100 Japanese yen and down at 1.0713 from 1.0699 against the Hong Kong dollar.
